00007 #ifndef __IM_COLOR_H
00008 #define __IM_COLOR_H
00009 
00010 #include "im_math.h"
00011 
00012 /** \defgroup color Color Manipulation
00013  *
00014  * \par
00015  * Functions to convert from one color space to another, 
00016  * and color gammut utilities.
00017  * \par
00018  * See \ref im_color.h
00019  *
00020  * \section s1 Some Color Science
00021  * \par
00022  * Y is luminance, a linear-light quantity. 
00023  * It is directly proportional to physical intensity
00024  * weighted by the spectral sensitivity of human vision.
00025  * \par
00026  * L* is lightness, a nonlinear luminance
00027  * that aproximates the perception of brightness. 
00028  * It is nearly perceptual uniform.
00029  * It has a range of 0 to 100.
00030  * \par
00031  * Y' is luma, a nonlinear luminance that aproximates lightness.
00032  * \par
00033  * Brightness is a visual sensation according to which an area
00034  * apears to exhibit more or less light. 
00035  * It is a subjective quantity and can not be measured.
00036  * \par
00037  * One unit of euclidian distante in CIE L*u*v* or CIE L*a*b* corresponds
00038  * roughly to a just-noticeable difference (JND) of color.
00039  * \par
00040 \verbatim
00041  ChromaUV = sqrt(u*u + v*v)       
00042  HueUV = atan2(v, u)
00043  SaturationUV = ChromaUV / L      (called psychometric saturation) 
00044  (the same can be calculated for Lab)
00045 \endverbatim
00046  * \par
00047  * IEC 61966-2.1 Default RGB colour space - sRGB
00048  * \li ITU-R Recommendation BT.709 (D65 white point).
00049  * \li D65 White Point (X,Y,Z) = (0.9505 1.0000 1.0890)
00050  * \par
00051  * Documentation extracted from  Charles Poynton - Digital Video and HDTV - Morgan Kaufmann - 2003.
00052  *
00053  * \section Links
00054  * \li www.color.org - ICC
00055  * \li www.srgb.com - sRGB
00056  * \li www.poynton.com - Charles Poynton
00057  * \li www.littlecms.com - A free Color Management System (use this if you need precise color conversions)
00058  *
00059  * \section cci Color Component Intervals
00060  * \par
00061  * When minimum and maximum values must be pre-defined values,
00062  * the following values are used:
00063  * \par
00064 \verbatim
00065  byte   [0,255]              (1 byte)
00066  short  [-32768,32767]       (2 bytes)
00067  ushort [0,65535]            (2 bytes)
00068  int    [-8388608,+8388607]  (3 bytes of 4 possible)
00069  float  [0,1]                (4 bytes)
00070 \endverbatim
00071  * Usually this intervals are used when converting from real to integer,
00072  * and when demoting an integer data type.  
00073  * \ingroup util */
00074 
00075 /** Returns the zero value for YCbCr color conversion. \n
00076  * When data type is unsigned Cb and Cr are shifted to 0-max.
00077  * So before they can be used in conversion equations 
00078  * Cb and Cr values must be shifted back to fix the zero position.
00079  * \ingroup color */
00080 inline float imColorZeroShift(int data_type)
00081 {
00082   float zero[] = {128.0f,     // [-128,+127]
00083                   0,      
00084                   32768.0f,   // [-32768,+32767]
00085                   0, 
00086                   0, 
00087                   0};      
00088   return zero[data_type];
00089 }
00090 
00091 /** Returns the maximum value for pre-defined color conversion porpouses. \n
00092  * See \ref cci.
00093  * \ingroup color */
00094 inline int imColorMax(int data_type)
00095 {
00096   int max[] = {255,      
00097                32767,    
00098                65535,    
00099                8388607,  
00100                1,        
00101                0};
00102   return max[data_type];
00103 }
00104 
00105 /** Returns the minimum value for pre-defined color conversion porpouses. \n
00106  * See \ref cci.
00107  * \ingroup color */
00108 inline int imColorMin(int data_type)
00109 {
00110   int min[] = {0,        
00111                -32768,   
00112                0,        
00113                -8388608, 
00114                0,        
00115                0};
00116   return min[data_type];
00117 }
00118 
00119 /** Quantize 0-1 values into min-max. \n
00120  * Value are usually integers,
00121  * but the dummy quantizer uses real values.
00122  * See also \ref math.
00123  * \ingroup color */
00124 template <class T> 
00125 inline T imColorQuantize(const float& value, const T& min, const T& max)
00126 {
00127   if (max == 1) return (T)value; // to allow a dummy quantizer
00128   if (value >= 1) return max;
00129   if (value <= 0) return min;
00130   float range = (float)max - (float)min + 1.0f;
00131   return (T)imRound(value*range - 0.5f) + min;
00132 }                               
00133 
00134 /** Reconstruct min-max values into 0-1. \n
00135  * Values are usually integers,
00136  * but the dummy reconstructor uses real values.
00137  * See also \ref math.
00138  * \ingroup color */
00139 template <class T> 
00140 inline float imColorReconstruct(const T& value, const T& min, const T& max)
00141 {
00142   if (max == 1) return (float)value;  // to allow a dummy reconstructor
00143   if (value <= min) return 0;
00144   if (value >= max) return 1;
00145   float range = (float)max - (float)min + 1.0f;
00146   return (((float)value - (float)min + 0.5f)/range);
00147 }
00148 
00149 /** Converts Y'CbCr to R'G'B' (all nonlinear). \n
00150  * ITU-R Recommendation 601-1 with no headroom/footroom.
00151 \verbatim
00152  0 <= Y <= 1 ; -0.5 <= CbCr <= 0.5 ; 0 <= RGB <= 1 
00153 
00154  R'= Y' + 0.000 *Cb + 1.402 *Cr
00155  G'= Y' - 0.344 *Cb - 0.714 *Cr
00156  B'= Y' + 1.772 *Cb + 0.000 *Cr
00157 \endverbatim
00158  * \ingroup color */
00159 template <class T> 
00160 inline void imColorYCbCr2RGB(const T Y, const T Cb, const T Cr, 
00161                              T& R, T& G, T& B,
00162                              const T& zero, const T& min, const T& max)
00163 {
00164   float r = float(Y                        + 1.402f * (Cr - zero));
00165   float g = float(Y - 0.344f * (Cb - zero) - 0.714f * (Cr - zero));
00166   float b = float(Y + 1.772f * (Cb - zero));
00167 
00168   // now we should enforce min <= rgb <= max
00169   R = (T)IM_CROPMINMAX(r, min, max);
00170   G = (T)IM_CROPMINMAX(g, min, max);
00171   B = (T)IM_CROPMINMAX(b, min, max);
00172 }
00173 
00174 /** Converts R'G'B' to Y'CbCr (all nonlinear). \n
00175  * ITU-R Recommendation 601-1 with no headroom/footroom.
00176 \verbatim
00177  0 <= Y <= 1 ; -0.5 <= CbCr <= 0.5 ; 0 <= RGB <= 1 
00178 
00179  Y' =  0.299 *R' + 0.587 *G' + 0.114 *B'
00180  Cb = -0.169 *R' - 0.331 *G' + 0.500 *B'
00181  Cr =  0.500 *R' - 0.419 *G' - 0.081 *B'
00182 \endverbatim
00183  * \ingroup color */
00184 template <class T> 
00185 inline void imColorRGB2YCbCr(const T R, const T G, const T B, 
00186                              T& Y, T& Cb, T& Cr,
00187                              const T& zero)
00188 {
00189   Y  = (T)( 0.299f *R + 0.587f *G + 0.114f *B);
00190   Cb = (T)(-0.169f *R - 0.331f *G + 0.500f *B + (float)zero);
00191   Cr = (T)( 0.500f *R - 0.419f *G - 0.081f *B + (float)zero);
00192 }
00193 
00194 /** Converts C'M'Y'K' to R'G'B' (all nonlinear). \n
00195  * This is a poor conversion that works for a simple visualization.
00196 \verbatim
00197   0 <= CMYK <= 1 ; 0 <= RGB <= 1 
00198 
00199   R = (1 - K) * (1 - C)
00200   G = (1 - K) * (1 - M)
00201   B = (1 - K) * (1 - Y)
00202 \endverbatim
00203  * \ingroup color */
00204 template <class T>
00205 inline void imColorCMYK2RGB(const T C, const T M, const T Y, const T K, 
00206                             T& R, T& G, T& B, const T& max)
00207 {
00208   T W = max - K;
00209   R = (T)((W * (max - C)) / max);
00210   G = (T)((W * (max - M)) / max);
00211   B = (T)((W * (max - Y)) / max);
00212 }
00213 
00214 /** Converts CIE XYZ to Rec 709 RGB (all linear). \n
00215  * ITU-R Recommendation BT.709 (D65 white point). \n
00216 \verbatim
00217   0 <= XYZ <= 1 ; 0 <= RGB <= 1    
00218 
00219   R =  3.2406 *X - 1.5372 *Y - 0.4986 *Z
00220   G = -0.9689 *X + 1.8758 *Y + 0.0415 *Z
00221   B =  0.0557 *X - 0.2040 *Y + 1.0570 *Z
00222 \endverbatim
00223  * \ingroup color */
00224 template <class T>
00225 inline void imColorXYZ2RGB(const T X, const T Y, const T Z, 
00226                            T& R, T& G, T& B)
00227 {
00228   float r =  3.2406f *X - 1.5372f *Y - 0.4986f *Z;
00229   float g = -0.9689f *X + 1.8758f *Y + 0.0415f *Z;
00230   float b =  0.0557f *X - 0.2040f *Y + 1.0570f *Z;
00231 
00232   // we need to crop because not all XYZ colors are visible
00233   R = (T)IM_FLOATCROP(r);
00234   G = (T)IM_FLOATCROP(g);
00235   B = (T)IM_FLOATCROP(b);
00236 }
00237 
00238 /** Converts Rec 709 RGB to CIE XYZ (all linear). \n
00239  * ITU-R Recommendation BT.709 (D65 white point). \n
00240 \verbatim
00241   0 <= XYZ <= 1 ; 0 <= RGB <= 1    
00242 
00243   X = 0.4124 *R + 0.3576 *G + 0.1805 *B
00244   Y = 0.2126 *R + 0.7152 *G + 0.0722 *B
00245   Z = 0.0193 *R + 0.1192 *G + 0.9505 *B
00246 \endverbatim
00247  * \ingroup color */
00248 template <class T>
00249 inline void imColorRGB2XYZ(const T R, const T G, const T B, 
00250                            T& X, T& Y, T& Z)
00251 {
00252   X = (T)(0.4124f *R + 0.3576f *G + 0.1805f *B);
00253   Y = (T)(0.2126f *R + 0.7152f *G + 0.0722f *B);
00254   Z = (T)(0.0193f *R + 0.1192f *G + 0.9505f *B);
00255 }
00256 
00257 #define IM_FWLAB(_w) (_w > 0.008856f?               \
00258                         powf(_w, 1.0f/3.0f):        \
00259                         7.787f * _w + 0.16f/1.16f)
00260 
00261 /** Converts CIE XYZ (linear) to CIE L*a*b* (nonlinear). \n
00262  * The white point is D65. \n
00263 \verbatim
00264   0 <= L <= 1 ; -0.5 <= ab <= +0.5 ; 0 <= XYZ <= 1 
00265 
00266   if (t > 0.008856)
00267     f(t) = pow(t, 1/3)
00268   else
00269     f(t) = 7.787*t + 16/116
00270 
00271   fX = f(X / Xn)      fY = f(Y / Yn)      fZ = f(Z / Zn)
00272 
00273   L = 1.16 * fY - 0.16
00274   a = 2.5 * (fX - fY)
00275   b = (fY - fZ)
00276 
00277 \endverbatim
00278  * \ingroup color */
00279 inline void imColorXYZ2Lab(const float X, const float Y, const float Z, 
00280                            float& L, float& a, float& b)
00281 {
00282   float fX = X / 0.9505f;  // white point D65
00283   float fY = Y / 1.0f;
00284   float fZ = Z / 1.0890f;
00285 
00286   fX = IM_FWLAB(fX);
00287   fY = IM_FWLAB(fY);
00288   fZ = IM_FWLAB(fZ);
00289 
00290   L = 1.16f * fY - 0.16f;
00291   a = 2.5f * (fX - fY);
00292   b = (fY - fZ);
00293 }
00294 
00295 #define IM_GWLAB(_w)  (_w > 0.20689f?                     \
00296                          powf(_w, 3.0f):                  \
00297                          0.1284f * (_w - 0.16f/1.16f))
00298 
00299 /** Converts CIE L*a*b* (nonlinear) to CIE XYZ (linear). \n
00300  * The white point is D65. \n
00301  * 0 <= L <= 1 ; -0.5 <= ab <= +0.5 ; 0 <= XYZ <= 1 
00302  * \ingroup color */
00303 inline void imColorLab2XYZ(const float L, const float a, const float b, 
00304                            float& X, float& Y, float& Z)
00305 
00306 {
00307   float fY = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
00308   float gY = IM_GWLAB(fY);
00309 
00310   float fgY = IM_FWLAB(gY);
00311   float gX = fgY + a / 2.5f;
00312   float gZ = fgY - b;
00313   gX = IM_GWLAB(gX);
00314   gZ = IM_GWLAB(gZ);
00315 
00316   X = gX * 0.9505f;     // white point D65
00317   Y = gY * 1.0f;
00318   Z = gZ * 1.0890f;
00319 }
00320 
00321 /** Converts CIE XYZ (linear) to CIE L*u*v* (nonlinear). \n
00322  * The white point is D65. \n
00323 \verbatim
00324   0 <= L <= 1 ; -1 <= uv <= +1 ; 0 <= XYZ <= 1
00325 
00326   Y = Y / 1.0      (for D65)
00327   if (Y > 0.008856)
00328     fY = pow(Y, 1/3)
00329   else
00330     fY = 7.787 * Y + 0.16/1.16
00331   L = 1.16 * fY - 0.16
00332 
00333   U(x, y, z) = (4 * x)/(x + 15 * y + 3 * z)
00334   V(x, y, z) = (9 * x)/(x + 15 * y + 3 * z)
00335   un = U(Xn, Yn, Zn) = 0.1978      (for D65)
00336   vn = V(Xn, Yn, Zn) = 0.4683      (for D65)
00337   fu = U(X, Y, Z) 
00338   fv = V(X, Y, Z) 
00339 
00340   u = 13 * L * (fu - un)
00341   v = 13 * L * (fv - vn)
00342 \endverbatim
00343  * \ingroup color */
00344 inline void imColorXYZ2Luv(const float X, const float Y, const float Z, 
00345                            float& L, float& u, float& v)
00346 {
00347   float XYZ = (float)(X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
00348   float fY = Y / 1.0f;
00349 
00350   if (XYZ != 0)
00351   {
00352     L = 1.16f * IM_FWLAB(fY) - 0.16f;
00353     u = 6.5f * L * ((4 * X)/XYZ - 0.1978f);
00354     v = 6.5f * L * ((9 * Y)/XYZ - 0.4683f);
00355   }
00356   else
00357   {
00358     L = u = v = 0;
00359   }
00360 }
00361 
00362 /** Converts CIE L*u*v* (nonlinear) to CIE XYZ (linear). \n
00363  * The white point is D65.
00364  * 0 <= L <= 1 ; -0.5 <= uv <= +0.5 ; 0 <= XYZ <= 1 \n
00365  * \ingroup color */
00366 inline void imColorLuv2XYZ(const float L, const float u, const float v, 
00367                            float& X, float& Y, float& Z)
00368 
00369 {
00370   float fY = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
00371   Y = IM_GWLAB(fY) * 1.0f;
00372 
00373   float ul = 0.1978f, vl = 0.4683f;
00374   if (L != 0)
00375   {
00376     ul = u / (6.5f * L) + 0.1978f;
00377     vl = v / (6.5f * L) + 0.4683f;
00378   }
00379 
00380   X = ((9 * ul) / (4 * vl)) * Y;
00381   Z = ((12 - 3 * ul - 20 * vl) / (4 * vl)) * Y;
00382 }
00383 
00384 /** Converts nonlinear values to linear values. \n
00385  * We use the sRGB transfer function. sRGB uses ITU-R 709 primaries and D65 white point. \n
00386 \verbatim
00387   0 <= l <= 1 ; 0 <= v <= 1 
00388 
00389   if (v < 0.03928)
00390     l = v / 12.92
00391   else
00392     l = pow((v + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)
00393 \endverbatim
00394  * \ingroup color */                           
00395 inline float imColorTransfer2Linear(const float& nonlinear_value)
00396 {
00397   if (nonlinear_value < 0.03928f)
00398     return nonlinear_value / 12.92f;
00399   else
00400     return powf((nonlinear_value + 0.055f) / 1.055f, 2.4f);
00401 }
00402 
00403 /** Converts linear values to nonlinear values. \n
00404  * We use the sRGB transfer function. sRGB uses ITU-R 709 primaries and D65 white point. \n
00405 \verbatim
00406   0 <= l <= 1 ; 0 <= v <= 1 
00407 
00408   if (l < 0.0031308)
00409     v = 12.92 * l
00410   else
00411     v = 1.055 * pow(l, 1/2.4) - 0.055
00412 \endverbatim
00413  * \ingroup color */                           
00414 inline float imColorTransfer2Nonlinear(const float& value)
00415 {
00416   if (value < 0.0031308f)
00417     return 12.92f * value;
00418   else
00419     return 1.055f * powf(value, 1.0f/2.4f) - 0.055f;
00420 }
00421 
00422 /** Converts RGB (linear) to R'G'B' (nonlinear).
00423  * \ingroup color */
00424 inline void imColorRGB2RGBNonlinear(const float RL, const float GL, const float BL,
00425                                     float& R, float& G, float& B)
00426 {
00427   R = imColorTransfer2Nonlinear(RL);
00428   G = imColorTransfer2Nonlinear(GL);
00429   B = imColorTransfer2Nonlinear(BL);
00430 }
00431 
00432 /** Converts R'G'B' to Y' (all nonlinear). \n
00433 \verbatim
00434  Y'  =  0.299 *R' + 0.587 *G' + 0.114 *B'
00435 \endverbatim
00436  * \ingroup color */
00437 template <class T> 
00438 inline T imColorRGB2Luma(const T R, const T G, const T B)
00439 {
00440   return (T)((299 * R + 587 * G + 114 * B) / 1000);
00441 }
00442 
00443 /** Converts Luminance (CIE Y) to Lightness (CIE L*) (all linear). \n
00444  * The white point is D65.
00445 \verbatim
00446   0 <= Y <= 1 ; 0 <= L* <= 1
00447 
00448   Y = Y / 1.0      (for D65)
00449   if (Y > 0.008856)
00450     fY = pow(Y, 1/3)
00451   else
00452     fY = 7.787 * Y + 0.16/1.16
00453   L = 1.16 * fY - 0.16
00454 \endverbatim
00455  * \ingroup color */
00456 inline float imColorLuminance2Lightness(const float& Y)
00457 {
00458   return 1.16f * IM_FWLAB(Y) - 0.16f;
00459 }
00460 
00461 /** Converts Lightness (CIE L*) to Luminance (CIE Y) (all linear). \n
00462  * The white point is D65.
00463 \verbatim
00464   0 <= Y <= 1 ; 0 <= L* <= 1
00465 
00466   fY = (L + 0.16)/1.16
00467   if (fY > 0.20689)
00468     Y = pow(fY, 3)
00469   else
00470     Y = 0.1284 * (fY - 0.16/1.16)
00471   Y = Y * 1.0      (for D65)
00472 \endverbatim
00473  * \ingroup color */
00474 inline float imColorLightness2Luminance(const float& L)
00475 {
00476   float fY = (L + 0.16f) / 1.16f;
00477   return IM_GWLAB(fY);
00478 }

00480 #undef IM_FWLAB
00481 #undef IM_GWLAB
00482 #undef IM_CROPL
00483 #undef IM_CROPC
